page.title: 12WIVENHOE 70 YEARS AGO
page.content: brother arrived when I was 18. { {Kelly: }What time did you finish school? {Mrs.Allen: }4 o'clock. At half past 3 the Infants, at 4 the Juniors. {Kelly: }What do you remember most about Wivenhoe when you first moved here and why? {Mrs.Allen:}Well, I don't remember living anywhere else. I was born in Rowhedge - that's just over the river. I don't remember livino there. I was brought over as a baby. I first lived in Anglesea Road and I can remember Anglesea Road well because there was a high brick wall. It went all the way down the middle of the road which was the boundary of
